text: is a former Japanese football player. She played for the Japan national team. ==Biography== Sato was born in Isesaki on January 1, 1976. After graduating from high school, she joined Nikko Securities Dream Ladies in 1994. The club was disbanded in 1998 due to financial strain. She moved to OKI FC Winds in 1999. However, the club was disbanded end of season. She moved to YKK Tohoku Ladies SC Flappers (later TEPCO Mareeze) in 2000. In 2000 season, she was selected Best Eleven. She retired in 2006. On May 31, 2000, Sato debuted for the Japan national team against Australia. She played at 2001 AFC Championship. She played 17 games and scored 4 goals for Japan until 2002. ==Statistics== Japan Football Association Japan national team Year Apps Goals 2000 4 1 2001 9 3 2002 4 0 Total 17 4 ==References== Category:1976 births Category:Living people Category:Footballers from Gunma Prefecture Category:Japan women's international footballers Category:Nadeshiko League players Category:Nikko Securities Dream Ladies players Category:OKI FC Winds players Category:TEPCO Mareeze players Category:2001 AFC Women's Championship players
title: Harue Sato
